title: Why is individualism so important in our society? - Quora

response.answer_text: Individualism is the value system that gives primacy to ‘self’ as the smallest indivisible unit of ‘conditional’, efficacious life. The point at issue here is that: Life is conditional - you have to work on itLife is hard - you have to work on it. It takes skills. It is not automatic or self-evident for humans. Humans cannot simply ‘eat grass’. It takes work, organisation and intelligence.Human life is social - so it demands abstract principles to relate to others; and by principles I mean ‘principles to ascertain what is whose’, and ‘who did what’ to earn any value. Just because ‘life is social’ doesn’t mean ‘individual life is subordinate to the group, or ‘society has primacy’ as the sociology school of thought supposes.Values are scarce for humans - Our ability to abstract means that ‘we can create immense value and ‘transformative states of being’ far removed from the manner in which animals live. People think ‘humans are animals’, and it is true humans can function at ‘the level of animals’. But humans also have the discretion to ‘rise above animals’, which takes humans to a higher level of being. As high as god, you might ask? Actually higher. The bible is full of contradictions. It is the words of flawed men. Men can go higher.Values are contingent and contextual. There is no such thing as ‘a social value’. No sooner has one expressed ‘a collective value’, and one has succumb to a dogma, because values are inherently personal because the interpreter of values is personal. Even for conjoined twins, sharing a body with two heads. They are no less ‘two persons’, two individuals forced to share a bedroom by their nature, lest science finds a way for them to part. How’s that for context!

That’s because the flourishing of individuals requires the development of the individual’s ability to reason — that is, to understand the facts of reality as they pertain to their interests and well being — and so to engage in rational self-direction and self-determination. In short, we need individualism to mature as adults and to pursue happiness. Otherwise, you end up with a society of childish adults who are fit only to be led and to be slaves of whatever supremely privileged people are in charge.
